> One will be against latest snapshots of dependencies

Do I understand this flow correctly?

- New code lands on `angular/angular` master
- A snapshot build is pushed to `angular/core-builds`
- Renovate should submit a PR back to `angular/angular` updating the integrations `package.json` to point to the new commit?

And how exactly would it specify the "latest snaphot"? I notice that `angular/core-builds` seems to have both branches and tags, so I'm not sure I know what naming/tagging convention you have in use.

> We'll change the integration test runner so that it kicks off the test N times, once for each package.json file.

The package.json files will be within separate subdirectories within that particular "integration" folder?
